triples.name: Human-computer interaction
triples.relevance: IUI research draws on HCI to study methods for supporting users across varied tasks and platforms.

triples.name: Artificial intelligence
triples.relevance: IUI research draws on AI techniques to develop intelligent user interface capabilities.

triples.name: Adaptive user interface
triples.relevance: Adaptive interfaces that modify their layout based on user needs were a key focus area of IUI'03 research.

triples.name: Computer-supported collaboration
triples.relevance: Collaborative interfaces enabling multiple users to work together were a major research area at the conference.

triples.name: Affective computing
triples.relevance: The conference highlighted affective interfaces that address psychological concerns like emotion in user interactions.

triples.name: Agent-based model
triples.relevance: Agent-based interfaces using autonomous agents to support users were presented as an oral presentation area.

triples.name: Knowledge acquisition
triples.relevance: Knowledge acquisition and visualization were key topics in the oral presentations at IUI'03.

triples.name: Data and information visualization
triples.relevance: Knowledge visualization techniques were presented as a major research area at the conference.

triples.name: Model-based design
triples.relevance: Model-based interface design approaches were featured as an oral presentation topic at IUI'03.

triples.name: Multimodal interaction
triples.relevance: Multimodal input allowing users to interact through multiple modes of communication was a conference presentation area.

triples.name: Natural language processing
triples.relevance: Natural language interfaces and semantic information processing of spoken language were key conference topics.

triples.name: Tangible user interface
triples.relevance: Hiroshi Ishii's invited talk on Tangible Bits presented a vision for seamless interfaces between people, bits, and atoms.

triples.name: Emotion recognition
triples.relevance: Emotion recognition is central to addressing psychological concerns like emotion in intelligent user interfaces.

triples.name: Personality
triples.relevance: Personality was identified as a key psychological concern that interfaces should address beyond rational intelligence.

triples.name: Motivation
triples.relevance: Motivation was highlighted as an important psychological factor for interfaces to consider in supporting user interactions.

triples.name: Speech recognition
triples.relevance: Speech recognition is key to semantic information processing of spoken language discussed in Allen Gorin's invited talk.
